etymology.interpretation: Names a hawthorn that commonly grows on hillsides; 山 marks wild/mountain origin while 楂 is the specific tree/fruit. Often refers both to the tree and its tart red fruit used in snacks like 冰糖葫芦.

parts.english: hawthorn tree; hawthorn fruit; (bot.) Crataegus; tart red berry

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢酸甜的山楂(我最喜歡酸甜的山楂)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuan suāntián de shānzhā.
examples.english: I love the sweet-tart taste of hawthorn.

examples.chinese: 秋天时(秋天時)，山楂成熟(山楂成熟)，市场上到处可见(市場上到處可見)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān shí, shānzhā chéngshú, shìchǎng shàng dàochù kějiàn.
examples.english: In autumn, hawthorns ripen and can be seen everywhere in the markets.

examples.chinese: 她用山楂做了冰糖葫芦(她用山楂做了冰糖葫蘆)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shānzhā zuò le bīngtáng húlu.
